Edited by Megan O'Shea for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description Materials are in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Joseph Vogel Drawings
Vogel, Joseph, 1911-1995
ALBA.GRAPHICS.003
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
circa 1937-1939 Joseph Vogel (1911-1995) was born in Poland and emigrated to the United States with his family in 1927. In January 1937 he volunteered to fight in Spain. The Joseph Vogel Drawings consist of 27 pen-and-ink drawings that Vogel made while in Spain during the Spanish Civil War.
Biographical Note
Joseph Vogel (1911-1995) was born in Poland and emigrated to the United States with his family in 1927. They settled in New York and Vogel became a student at the National Academy of Design and the Art Students League. During the early 1930s Vogel was employed by the WPA and worked as assistant to Ben Shahn on a mural project. In January 1937 he volunteered to fight in Spain and was assigned to the 86th Brigade's Mixed Brigade.
Scope and Contents
The collection consists of 27 pen-and-ink drawings that Vogel made while in Spain, depicting soldiers in combat and at rest as well as Spanish civilians in traditional attire.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open to researchers.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Joseph Vogel Drawings; ALBA.GRAPHICS.003; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2020 are unknown. In 2020 description was updated for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description.
